Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean room, good location”
Reviews.Author: Brick83
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Ca' San Polo and could not have been happier. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and had all the amenities you will need. The women that run the hotel are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good- pastries, fruit, coffee, tea, and cold cuts. It's about a ten minute walk from the train station, in a safe neighborhood. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and cosy”
Reviews.Author: aplund
Reviews.Content: Lovely, elegant room. In the evening a little noise from the street but quiet during the night. Central location, familial feeling and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SBCarol
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Ca' San Polo. The hotel is close to attractions, but tucked away in a small, quiet street. Our room was lovely and we enjoyed the breakfast buffet each morning. The hotel's manager gave us great tips for restaurants and all of the staff were friendly and efficient. We were so impressed by the high level of service in this small hotel; it made what might have been a good visit, a great visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “For Venice this is a good value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoldstarSteve
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the comments in the other reviews. The hotel is well located in the San Palo area about 20-25 mins walk to San Marco, 20-25 min walk to the Academia, 15-20 min walk to Rialto and 20-25 min walk in other direction to the Jewish Ghetto. For me this is an ideal location although for those misguided souls for whom Venice in just St Marco it may be a bit out of the center. The staff were very friendly and willing to help - in my case that included the gracious manageress helping me with the heavy luggage. Yes its a historic building - but most are in Venice, We were in the room on the top floor with wood ceiling and opposite the small public terrace which is simple enough but a nice place to sit. I was slightly disappointed with the breakfast which was fairly minimal but adequate. We paid 287 Euro for 3 days in March which would be outrageous price for this kind of accommodation anywhere else in Italy but is actually "Budget accommodation" for this kind of place and position in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rach6101
Reviews.Content: We were very happy staying at Ca' San Polo. The location was great, and well signposted. Room was air-conditioned and very comfortable. Our room was located right next to the breakfast room, but the noise was not a problem at all. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “All excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dave O
Reviews.Content: Fine location, close to all places that you want to see. Room was very romantic, comfortable and clean, quiet at night. Tasty bearkfast. Always very friendly and kind staff. Surely we will come back someday and I recommend to all to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lavella
Reviews.Content: + Cosy rooms Very clean Tasty breakfast Very quiet at night All the appliances in the room Friendly staff - Frightfool streets in the evening (in winter it's dark at 19:00 and no people at the nearest streets) Uncomfortable beds No view from the window and always dark in the room

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, great price”
Reviews.Author: CCE_2
Reviews.Content: Very centrical and convenient, close to everything in Venice. Very nice and professional staff with lots of caring details. Very clean and comfortable rooms. We have just returned from our 4 nights stay in Venice, 26-30th December. We have enjoyed a lot. We will surely return. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal!”
Reviews.Author: Dcookies
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, quiet and in the centre of everything at the same time. 5 min nice walk to Rialto,10min nice walk to St.Marks,1min away from water bus or gondola service. Beautiful, romantic, clean and very warm rooms (independent temp control). Amazingly kind, helpful and friendly staff. Fair breakfast. Best price in town. I would go again and again and I suggest this to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comforable”
Reviews.Author: mzz36f
Reviews.Content: As you can understand the rooms are small. And this hotel is hidden so beware if your finding your own way to the hotel. The staff were very friendly and told us about places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Venice itself!”
Reviews.Author: KeithB17
Reviews.Content: Considering all the hotels in Venice are pricey, this is quite an affordable one with breakfast included. Nothing to rave about for breakfast but the location was near a waterbus stop. It is easy to be lost in Venice streets so the street signs to the hotel, accompanied by some instructions from the hotel beforehand helped quite a bit. Hotel reception was friendly and pointed out the main attractions to us when we checked in. Overall a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is small except the friendliness”
Reviews.Author: NYCleveland
Reviews.Content: It was a trek to find this hotel from the train station but once we located it we really enjoyed our two nights here. The staff was very friendly, especially Francesco, who helped us with restaurant suggestions. The stairways are extremely narrow, and the room was small but it was great for a couple. The bathroom was bigger than we expected. The rooftop patio was small but very nice, especially at night. The only downsides were that there was limited (but free) wifi in the hotel; there was none in the room. The breakfast was OK but the service was very friendly. The rooms are very close together, so we we able to hear every coming and going. Overall this was a great small hotel on a very quiet street in Venice. Recommended for couples.

Reviews.Title: “unusual”
Reviews.Author: PeterCUk
Reviews.Content: we followed the instructions given to the hotel , but it only said get off at the st toma waterbus stop , luckily I had printed off the address and we bought a streetmap which the street was listed on , otherwise we would have had trouble finding it . There were a couple of signs attached to walls nearby which helped. When we turned into the street we thought "where is it" as it was not obvious there was a hotel there at all , there were 2 doors that looked like someones front door with a buzzer at the side so we tried one and the door opened , up some narrow stairs was a reception. The room we got was nothing like the size of the one in the picture on their website , ours was very compact - looking at the hotel plan on the fire escape plans it looked like we got the smallest room, having said that it , it was clean and nicely decorated with quality materials and we slept well. Staff were nice , breakfast room nice as was the food. Location - I booked this so that I was walking distance to the cruise terminal , as we were cruising the next day , we did manage to walk it but it took 20 minutes dragging my suitcase ( 10 mins without a suitcase) to the piazzle roma, if staying here I would reccomend getting the waterbus back to piazzle roma , then the people mover to the cruise terminal which cost 1 euro each way. For exploring venice itself location was fine. from the airport we got the ATVO bus which was fine

Reviews.Title: “Over over priced..”
Reviews.Author: Robertella
Reviews.Content: During my stay in venice,I stayed at a palazzo on the grand canal, for the same price.. Over over priced tiny hotel at a crowded cross streets.I couldn't sleep even with closed windows.when I entered the room it had a bad smell of cooking coming up from close restaurants. Also the sheets had a bad smell..I had to ask for another ones..but it had the same nasty smell..I believe they wash in cold water for economy concerns..The worst hotel experience I ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little B & B. Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Mandy H
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Italy and it started our trip off very well. The B & B is very conveniently located to everything in Venice and we easily walked everywhere. Service and room were great. Wireless internet, breakfast and terrace on top of the building were all very nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: tijjw
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and excellent pleasant staff. Even got an e-mail just before travel giving directions etc. One of the best value for money hotels we stayed at in Italy. Stayed with two teenage children in late August. Weather was hot and the children loved the air-con in the entrance hall and room. Plenty of decent eateries nearby and a supermarket at the end of the road for snacks and wine/beer. The hotel actually sits near to one of the major walking routes around Venice and once found for the first time is easy to find thereafter. We left a hire car at Tronchetto parking garage and chose to walk (30 min walk with overnight bag), the garage cost 21 euro for 24hrs. There was parking nearer to the bus station but it appeared to fill up earlier. Good fresh continental breakfast with reasonable selection (nothing like the picture showing a tray of packet food). Would not hesitate to recommend to anyone thinking of travelling to Venice for any type of break.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ross-rabbits
Reviews.Content: ok - this room was very small (we stayed in a quad room) but really, you can't expect too much space in Venice. It was small, but it was clean and nice enough. We only had wifi in the breakfast room but the staff were very upfront with that, so we knew exactly what to expect. We found the breakfast room really nice and the food was really pretty good. The staff were just lovely. It is in a fantastic location we just walked out in the morning and spent the day wandering. There is a lift to the 3rd floor that you can use for your luggage (we were on the 4th floor but the staff helped us up the one flight with our luggage). But overall, you only walk up those stairs once at the end of the day and you are not in your room for very long because there is way too much to do in Venice to stay in your room. It was pretty good value for money so I would definately stay here again. And if you leave the hotel, and turn to the left and then left around the corner, you will find the best sandwich/panini place in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantasic roof top balcony!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa015
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca' San Polo at the beginning of July for 3 nights with our 2 sons. We absolutely loved it! This was our fourth time in Venice so we decided to try a different hotel and were not disappointed. It is a bit further from the Rialto Bridge than we usually stay but it was an easy walk to the Rialto and then St. Mark's Square. It was really nice to stay in a new area as we explored new streets and canals. There are a lot of great shops in the area as well as several groceries stores. We had a family room for 4 people. It was a good sized room with lots of charm and with a large bathroom. It was very clean and very well kept. I think this hotel had the most comfortable beds of the whole trip...beware that beds in Italy are hard!! The room was very quiet and had good air conditioning which is important in Venice as you don't really get any breezes from the windows. The breakfast in the morning was really good and was served from about 7:30 until 10:00 am. The first morning we were at the hotel, we had flown from Canada to Rome and then driven about 6 hours to get to Venice. I thought we would wake up in the morning with no problems but we all slept in. The lady in the breakfast room called us at 10:00 to see if we were coming. I told her that we had all slept in and not to worry about it but she wouldn't hear of it, and she held breakfast for us until 10:30 so we could eat. The roof balcony was a real treat! It is fairly small so only 1 group at a time can really use it but we always found we could use it with no problem. It is nice to buy a bottle of wine and sit up there enjoying the views of the roof tops which are unique to Venice! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful! We took the vaporetto in and found the directions to the hotel were fairly good and we only had to ask for help 1 time. We walked out as it is an easy 10 minute walk out of Venice. Being that we were in Venice with kids, we didn't eat in any restaurants as they are on the pricey side but a highlight for us was stopping to get pizza and then sitting behind the fish market along the grand canal eating our pizza and watching the boats go by! There is a great little takeout pizza place about halfway between the hotel and the fish market on the left hand side that had some of the best pizza we had in all of Italy! Next time we go back to Venice, we will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: noleave-nolife12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in October 2010. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and our room was nice (not too big) but quiet, clean and comfortable. Location was quite convenient â€“ and although this wasnâ€™t in the â€˜tourist centralâ€™ part of Venice (rialto/san marco), it was about a 10 minute walk to Rialto Bridge. Although Venice can be hard to navigate (you will most likely get lost at least once if you havenâ€™t been there before!!), there is a supermarket and a couple of restaurants quite close by. While a few seemed to close before dinner, this may have been because of the time of year we were travelling. Probably the best way to get to the hotel when you first arrive is via a ferry , San Tomaâ€“ the nearest stop is about a 5 minute walk, but you only have to cross one or two bridges, so donâ€™t have to lift your bags/suitcases too often! Breakfast was included with our rate and was fairly standard toast, pastries and cereal â€“ but was more than adequate. If you get the chance, head up to the roof and there is a little patio up there. It is quite nice to sit up there and relax after a day exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bballfan1
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at the Hotel Ca' San Polo for 3 nights on our recent visit to Venice. We stayed in a quad room, which barely fit the 2 queen size beds it containined. But the beds were comfortable, and the high ceiling in the room made it feel more spacious. The staff was friendly, and the breakfast buffet was adequate. The hotels location in San Polo was both convenient (being close to a Vaporetto stop) and relatively quiet. The free internet did not work from our room or the breakfast room. All in all, we felt the these accommodations were a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a couple of nights in Venice”
Reviews.Author: tillyhorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a (superior) triple room in early May 2011. Booked through booking.com at ~Â£130/night. Let's get one thing clear, where space comes at a premium, staying on the actual island of Venice is not cheap. We chose this hotel due to reading reviews and was one of the cheaper 3-star hotels we could find available. The hotel is in a great location, about 10-15 minutes walk from Venice Santa Lucia station and 5-10 from the Rialto Bridge; it is well signposted so it's not too hard to find. The staff on the front desk were very friendly, welcoming and spoke decent English. Be warned that the hotel does not have a lift so if you intend to bring lots of heavy bags/suitcases, you will need to be prepared to lug them up a couple of flights of stairs. Our room was clean, of a good size and had lots of character: wooden beams in the ceilings as well as long red curtains. It was a decent size with one double bed and another collapsable double bed. We were not sure if this was meant to be a double or quadruple room. Whilst the standard double was comfortable, the fold-up one was not with a thin mattress, through which you could feel the supporting wooden slats; this allowed for an uncomfortable nights' sleep. The room had a small LCD TV, fridge, air-conditioning (the unit sat on the ground) and a safe. The bathroom was a good size and included a shower, bidet, sink and toilet. The continental breakfast had a disappointing selection of fruit, yogurts and cereal. In addition their conveyor-belt toaster was the slowest I had ever came across (it would take several passes to toast the bread sufficiently) and they supplied rather small pieces of bread to go with it. On the plus side the pastries offered were good. Although I would recommend this hotel to couples wishing to spend a few nights in Venice, on the basis of the bed I slept on, I would not recommend this to three/four people sharing a room

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to Rialto Bridge”
Reviews.Author: Dxgabriel
Reviews.Content: We (3 ladies) stayed in this hotel for three nights and we were satisfied with our stay. As written here the room was small but very nice furnished and clean. Enough for our stay - we were most of the day away in town. The staff is available from morning to evening and is very helpful. We were also very pleased about the brekfest bufet which was very good. The only problems were that we had a window to the street and the Italians (and maybe turists) were a little bit noisy till late night and we sometimes heard our neighbours from room next door. I can recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking for a nice hotel for great price. We enjoy great time in Venice and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best price/value ratio I know!”
Reviews.Author: Uncle_Marcus
Reviews.Content: This small hotel may go unnoticed for many, which is a great shame, because it is one of the best hotels i have had the honour to stay. The night at the cheapest room only cost us 50e, very low price for venice or Italy in general. It, however, provided such superb service, tasty breakfast and comfortable, warm room with a stylish old-fashioned interior that I would not hesitate one second to use this hotel again when I return to venice. If you look for high-end full-service luxorius hotel, this is not your spot, but with an affordable budget you can get a taste of old-fashioned hospitality and a home-like place in the heart of venice at Ca' San Polo. I warmly recommend for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, a bit very tiny room but the staff are friendly”
Reviews.Author: nicnpappy
Reviews.Content: The location is great and very close to Santa Maria Gloriosa dei Frari which is one of the church I really like. The breakfast is decent. But the staff are very friendly. The staff named Alyssa was pleasant to talk, very nice, & friendly. We need to check out very early to catch our 9:30 am flight out of Marco Polo. Talking to her about my check out the next day, she offered us a packed breakfast. She said that she'll ask somebody to prepare breakfast and leave it at our door. Next morning upon opening our door, there I saw a big brown bag with lots of muffins, pastries, & 12 tetra pack of orange juice. The place maybe bit tiny but they have an excellent service, and can't beat that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice tiny hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexbEve
Reviews.Content: Tiny nice hotel But the room was below the breakfast place which starts to be noisy early in the morning

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Rose_1969
Reviews.Content: Not value for money. Not recommended. But the staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Superb and cozy hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: thelittlegoldfish
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I couldn't be happier with the Ca' San Polo for our stay in Venice! We got a wonderful superior room with 15th century original wooden beams in the roof. The service was so incredibly kind, attentive and excellent. The location is great, once you get used to the street system of Venice. There are even street-signs just for the Ca' San Polo. The value for the price is excellent, and we will definitely stay there again, the next time we visit the city. Our holiday in Venice wouldn't have been the same without the Ca' San Polo. We can give it our warmest recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed in one hotel”
Reviews.Author: GraceM88
Reviews.Content: The san polo area is lovely, its close enough to everything but not too busy or touristy. The staff are soo lovely and helpful. Breakfast is really good. Tanning on the quiet terrace with a beer = perfect. The bathroom is clean, and cleaned daily. There is a safe and a bar fridge in our room which is handy. i would stay here again, and reccomend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hospitality in a well-kept quaint Bed and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Travelgoose44
Reviews.Content: The staff at Ca' San Polo were fantastic and helpful. They answered every question and helped us navigate our time in Venice. On the morning we left for the airport, in addition to providing us detailed directions to the airport via public transit, they packed us a huge breakfast to take on the road. Simply because we would be leaving before breakfast was set up. The hotel has free wireless, which seems to be a novelty in Europe. The room was wonderful, air-conditioned, and quiet. The neighborhood is conveniently located between Rialto and St. Mary of the Friar's Church, but the hotel is tucked just off a main street so it is quite private and quiet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that doesn't need a large spacious room but is looking for a secure, quiet, clean, well maintained hotel with wonderful staff and a nice breakfast in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Price”
Reviews.Author: moandoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ca San Polo for three nights the end of May. Reserved two rooms....one double and triple. Double was nice and roomy, triple was a bit cramped. Staff very friendly, rooms nicely appointed and baths were large and modern. Plenty of hot water and good water pressure which is not always a given in Venice. Breakfast was adaquate and location was even better. It's in a quieter part of town which is a relief after spending time at all the hot spots. The five of us would all stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Gingerpumpkin
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here. Excellent location - 10 minutes to the Rialto so very much in the thick of things. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Room and bathroom clean. Breakfast good for Italy (don't come here if you want a full fry up or waffles dripping in maple syrup). We had room 25 which was OK for our 2 nights but if staying for c.1 week see if they have anything bigger - our room did not have many cat swinging opportunities and extremely limited storage space. Interestingly the bathroom was relatively large and no issues with the shower/water temperature. We paid 135 euros per night (breakfast included) which was a bit steep for what you get but I guess this is Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, but "in the centre"”
Reviews.Author: Yorbo
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly..willing to help you, whatever u ask them. The walls in the bedrooms have the traditional "carpets" on the walls, beds are comfortabel, evrything was really clean & the rooms are equipped with everything u need...and nicely arranged! There is also a terrasse on the roof, which has a beautiful view =) Only point is, when ur travelling on duty, there is no wireless-ethernet available. But if u really need to check ur emails u can ask at the check-in counter to use their pc! The prices are ok, as the location is quiet (lovely if u dont want to get up at 6a.m.!) And the Vaporetto station (Main Line!) is about 2 Min. away.. also close to the Santa Maria Gloriosa dei Frari (church). Supermarket and nice resaurants close by! I can definitely recommend it, as i really enjoyed the stay!

Reviews.Title: “The staff was wonderful and the San Polo area is charming”
Reviews.Author: OTnana
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel was a bit of a challenge but it is Venice. With a few questions to locals we were able to locate it. The staff was wonderful in helping us get around town. The room was lovely, clean and true to the charm of Venice. If you are looking for a large room and modern appeal, this is not the place for you. If you want great hospitality, a wonderful breakfast, a room that is true to the area and a lovely roof top terrace, then this is a place you would like. As with most places be prepared to walk stairs. If you are unable to get up stairs, stay elsewhere. It is also very close to the Frari church ( which is well worth the visit ). The shops in the area are lovely, unfortunately I did not have time to visit many.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: CathyMPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this B&B quite by accident. We had booked and were confirmed with L'ocanda Sant Agostin but upon our arrival there were informed that our confirmed reservation had been cancelled. All turned out well in the end. This is a great place to stay. The room was very clean. Ricardo and the entire staff was extremely accomodating and helpful. Breakfast was very good. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lori_uop
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times and each time is just as good as the last. It's a bit confusing to find your first time, but once you understand a Venice map, it's no problem. 15 minute walk to either bus station, train station or St. Mark's square. Centrally located right off Grand Canal near the Rialto Bridge, great service and value...why pay the price of the big places on the canal when you get custom, family service for a great value? Wireless internet available upstairs - I sat outside on the deck, sipping my cauppuccino (from their fantastic auto machine) checking my email and making everyone at home totally jealous!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thinker-Bell76
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights as part of our 21-day European adventure. I would rate this hotel as the best hotel of our stay!!! First, the location is perfect. The *water" taxi drops you literally 5 mins *walk* away from the hotel. So to those travelers who maybe traveling with heavy luggage, you won't find urself dragging ur suitcases for a long ride. Secondly, even though Venice is a relatively small island, the location of this hotel is pretty cool. For shoppers, some very interesting stores & boutiques are located just around the hotel. Infact lots of restaurants there too. Didn't matter what hour of the day/night it was, there's constant traffic by the hotel. Never gets too loud but its just nice to see people strolling by at all hours. If you're traveling by urself or if you're only girls traveling, ull feel safe at all times. However, the BEST part of this hotel is the service -- the hotel manager, the gentleman, he's the NICEST guy on Earth, no kidding!! He made our Venice trip thousand times better. Everyday he put a smile on our face. We're the type of travelers who barely spend time in our hotels - for most of the day and night, we would be in the city, we'd only come to the hotel to sleep. And even then he managed to put a smile on our faces!!! The breakfast is superb! 2nd day we barely made it - only 10 mins left and even then, so many pastries and breads and other items were still there on the breakfast table. in fact the lady who was working the kitchen began to load fresh food items as soon as she spotted us in the room even tho we were late! I thought that calls for a brilliant service. Whatever you do, please remember to enjoy the roof of this hotel. On our 2nd night, we picked up some pizza and drinks at a random restaurant and ate our dinner on the roof of this hotel. There are tables and chairs up there even pool benches for you to get your tan (no pool tho!) It was so peaceful and relaxing - you get to see the full view of Venice - roofs of all buildings - if u get lucky, ull catch a glimpse of the locals sitting in their balconies enjoying the evenings of Venice!! Make sure you visit the St. Marks square at night - there are many mini concerts playing there at night and you'll thoroughly enjoy the experience. The gondola rides are pricey - 80 euros but tell the driver you can only afford 20 euros per person. We did that - we were 2 people - the driver was nice enough to find us another couple to split the overall ticket with so we each paid 20 euros for the ride! It was definitely worth it then!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and well worth the cost!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnC2009
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but seem to be the norm for venice. Rooms are fantastic and very clean. Well worth a visit if you want a affordable break in Venice. Staff were also great.

Reviews.Title: “Ca San Polo, Venice is the jewel”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthMI
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night. The staff was very friendly and the room was excellent. This one is a keeper for sure. We are a family of 4 with 2 kids under 10 years of age. We were pleasantly surprised by how convenient the location was.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, AMAZING staff!”
Reviews.Author: swdub
Reviews.Content: We finally escaped our dreadful hotel in Florence and were really looking forward to this hotel in Venice! It was a bit dificult to find. It looks very small from the outside but is quite large inside. We were greeted by a lovely staff member named Marco who even conversed with us in Chinese (where I'm originally from). He also speaks a few other languages! He was very helpful and friendly! The room was very nicely laid out and very clean! The bathroom was clean and nice, though there was damage done to the shower by previous guests. Apart from that, the room was very nice. The breakfast was tasty and the location of the hotel was good. I would definetly recommend this to all! The staff were the best I've ever met and very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: dangermouse_penfold
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and would recommend this hotel to travellers. It looks deceptively small from the outside, but is actually quite large. The location is quite central, just a 5min walk from the St. Tamas water-bus stop. Our room was very nice - i believe we were put in a room for 3 persons which was a bonus as it was a very large room. It was clean, with a nice bathroom and great shower. The breakfast was very good. The staff were polite and very helpful. I'd certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: zsiberian
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Location was tricky but actually pretty central if you want to hit most of the town within a couple of days. Staff was great, food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff! Charming room!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherJane13
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 4 night stay at Ca' San Polo and we were delighted with the professionalism of the staff. Upon our arrival in Venice we made our way to the hotel by vaporetto and with the help of a street map became hopelessly lost! Please please please google map your directions to this hotel. There are several streets in Venice with the same name. We called the hotel and Alberto (awesome!) was happy to walk us there over the phone. Apparently this is quite common. The room was small but absolutely charming and spotless. Also very quiet. The breakfast is my only slight complaint. The tables were not cleaned up very quickly and the choices were limited. Still, we managed and what was there was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana_Michel
Reviews.Content: For a 3 stars hotel, Ca' San Polo is great. The people are very helpful and joyful. The rooms were clean, spacious, and beautifully decorated. Washrooms were spotless.Breakfast was good. Hotel location is fine. We enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: afsjenny
Reviews.Content: Great little place in central location - a bit hard to find, though, when you first arrive. On the plus side, the staff is very helpful and pleasant - breakfast is wonderful, bath towels are oversized. Unfortunately, we were unable to unlock the door of the apartment which we had reserved, and had to drag our luggage back to the hotel in the dark, over bridges, etc. The owner was unapologetic for all our trouble, insisting the he had been able to open the door, even though his own staff person was unable to do so. Customers shouldn't have trouble opening the door to their apartments. The room we were given instead was a really tight squeeze for 4 people, and we had to insist on a price reduction from the originally reserved apartment.

Reviews.Title: “helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: martinaPlymouth
Reviews.Content: We were two older ladies on our first trip to Venice and found the hotel fairly easily with help of website map and signs on the walls. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. showed us around the hotel while we waited for them to change the beds into twin rather than a double. Breakfast was filling and kept us going until lunchtime very adequately. The room was about the size of an average hotel room and considering how we had been told how expensive Venice is we felt we got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful once you find it!”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoSomewhere07
Reviews.Content: We walked from the train station after an overnight trip from Paris. It is not really a 5 minute walk though. We were very tired and lugging our suitcases over 15 bridges only to find we were on the wrong side of the island was frustrating. However a very nice Italian man called the hotel and helped us get proper directions. We finally found the hotel (look for the little yellow signs!) but were too early to check in. The staff was very accomodating and held our luggage while we went to get some lunch and wine. When we did return, we were encouraged to upgrade (pay a little more) for a superior room. It was worth it! The room was small but very comfortable, charming, and clean. The location was central to everything. I recommend staying here and if you do, be sure to go to the roof (aka: smoking area) with a bottle of wine at around sunset (7:45pm) pm in the summer. You will get an incredible view of Venice and if you time it right, hear all the church bells from all over the island at 8pm. Also, I must mention that the desk clerk is quite handsome according to my 18 year old daughter!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Curtains do not make a room superior”
Reviews.Author: Saniman
Reviews.Content: I booked two "superior" double rooms for myself and another couple. Perhaps the word superior has a different meaning in Italian, but I honestly did not think that the two rooms on the fourth floor (no lift) truly merited that description. Nothing seriously wrong with them, both a reasonable size although not a great deal of space round the bed in ours, clean bathrooms, fresh towels every day etc. but not "superior" The breakfasts were good - more than one usually gets or expects in Italian hotels. I had absolutely no difficulty in finding the hotel which is in an obscure calle

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Families”
Reviews.Author: chavgopal
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in a convenient locatiion -- that can, nonethless, be hard to find if you don't know Venice. Make sure you get directions before you go. It is a 10 minute walk from Plaza Roma. We actually did not stay in the main hotel. We were two adults and two children and they put us up in a very well located apartment somewhat near the Guggenheim. If I was going with kids again I would specifically request the apartment as it was sufficfiently roomy and had a full kitchen -- and came at a pretty good price (for Venice). The only two complaints I have are that you needed to check-in and check-out of the main hotel (a 10-15 minute walk from the apartment) -- which was a pain with the luggage. In addition, the apartment had some severe hot water problems. I would specifically asked them whether those have been fixed before I booked it again. Overall, a very good choice for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Very good sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Wakefield-RI
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on a quiet little street a few easy minutes from a vaporetto stop and 20 minutes easy walk from the San Marco square. The room size was average by Venice standards, but extremely clean and the bathroom looked like it had just been remodeled. Breakfast was adequate and served in a lovely room with a view of Venice roofs. No view from our room, but it was very quiet and well appointed. Central air-conditioning was in perfect working order and kept us cool and happy at night despite the tremendous heat wave that wilted us by noon every day. No room is wasted for the reception desk, which is tucked away on the landing on the second floor. Still, whoever stood next to it was always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We Liked It”
Reviews.Author: KSH213
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend here at the beginning of July. We had a quadruple room. It looked like a suite with the extra double bed in the sitting room area. It made the room cramped, but still okay. The primary bed was comfortable, but the extra bed felt like a sofa pull out bed. Our arrival was delayed until airport transfer options were limited. Buses, water buses and Alilaguna all closed. Therefore we took a land taxi (30 euros) to Piazza Roma and walked from there. A water taxi would have cost triple that amount and, as it turns out, would not have saved much walking. The hotel night receptionist, Lidio I think his name was, was fantastically helpful. I called when we arrived and he helped with the transfer options. He then gave us very good walking directions to Frari Church, where he came to meet us. This was about 2 a.m. The hotel has an arrangement with a particular glass factory in Murano. They provide a free, private water taxi to the factory. You tour the factory and buy if you want. It was not high pressure at all. Your return trip is up to you. The water buses are about 5 euros each. You can buy a 24 hour pass for 11 euros each and it includes land buses. It was a nice European hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ca' San Polo
HotelInfo.Address: Sestiere San Polo 2696 | Calle de la Malvasia, 30125 Venice, Italy
